author: blogs.wsj.com
title: Real Time Economics: Are States Unprepared for the Next Recession? | Oil Prices Bubble | Amazon’s Pay
text: This is the web version of the WSJ’s daily economic newsletter. You can sign up for daily delivery here. Good morning! Today we look at what U.S. states are doing to prepare for the next downturn, rising oil prices, U.S. commercial relations with Europe and China, and the $28,446 paycheck of the typical Amazon employee. RAINY DAY FUNDS   Steel Tariffs Likely to Lead to U.S. Job Losses, Fed Economists Find
